Operation 'get_/users/{user-id}/followed-by' has semantic quality issues: missing_context, missing_output_details. Description lacks security scope information and doesn't clarify that this returns incoming followers (followers of the target user). Added security requirements and clarified the relationship direction for better AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

data.current_summary: Get the list of users this user is followed by.
data.current_description: Get the list of users this user is followed by. To get users followed by the owner of the access token, you can use **self** instead of the `user-id`.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve the list of users who follow the specified user (incoming followers). To get followers of the authenticated user, use **self** instead of the `user-id`. Returns a paginated list of user objects. Security scope `public_content` is required to read information about other users.
data.reasoning: Description lacks security scope information and doesn't clarify that this returns incoming followers (followers of the target user). Added security requirements and clarified the relationship direction for better AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'get_/users/{user-id}/follows' has semantic quality issues: missing_context, missing_output_details. Description is missing security scope information and doesn't clarify the relationship direction (outgoing follows). Added security requirements and explicitly stated this returns users being followed by the target user for improved AI agent clarity.

data.current_description: Get the list of users this user follows. To get follows of the owner of the access token, you can use **self** instead of the `user-id`.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve the list of users that the specified user follows (outgoing follows). To get users followed by the authenticated user, use **self** instead of the `user-id`. Returns a paginated list of user objects. Security scope `public_content` is required to read information about other users.
data.reasoning: Description is missing security scope information and doesn't clarify the relationship direction (outgoing follows). Added security requirements and explicitly stated this returns users being followed by the target user for improved AI agent clarity.

message: Operation 'get_/users/{user-id}/relationship' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_context. Description is too minimal and doesn't explain what relationship information is returned or the authentication context. Added details about return values (follow status, requests, blocking) and clarified that the relationship is from the authenticated user's perspective for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_summary: Get information about a relationship to another user.
data.current_description: Get information about a relationship to another user.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve the relationship status between the authenticated user and the specified target user. Returns relationship information including follow status, incoming/outgoing follow requests, and blocking status. This operation requires authentication and reflects the perspective of the authenticated user.
data.reasoning: Description is too minimal and doesn't explain what relationship information is returned or the authentication context. Added details about return values (follow status, requests, blocking) and clarified that the relationship is from the authenticated user's perspective for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'post_/users/{user-id}/relationship' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description is severely lacking. It doesn't specify what actions are available, what parameters are required, what is returned, or what side effects occur. Added action types, parameter requirements, return value, and side effects for AI agents to understand when and how to use this modification endpoint.

data.current_summary: Modify the relationship between the current user and the target user.
data.current_description: Modify the relationship between the current user and the target user.
data.summary_suggestion: Modify relationship status with another user.
data.description_suggestion: Modify the relationship between the authenticated user and the specified target user. Accepts an `action` parameter to follow, unfollow, block, unblock, approve, or deny follow requests. Returns the updated relationship status. This operation requires authentication and appropriate security scopes. Side effects include updating follower/following counts and triggering notifications.
data.reasoning: Description is severely lacking. It doesn't specify what actions are available, what parameters are required, what is returned, or what side effects occur. Added action types, parameter requirements, return value, and side effects for AI agents to understand when and how to use this modification endpoint.

message: Operation 'get_/tags/search' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original description is identical to summary and lacks detail about inputs, outputs, and how results are ordered. Added clarity about what the search query parameter does, what is returned (tag objects with metadata), and how results are ranked to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_summary: Search for tags by name.
data.current_description: Search for tags by name.
data.description_suggestion: Search for tags by name to discover content related to specific topics. Accepts a search query parameter and returns a list of matching tag objects with metadata. Results are ordered by relevance and popularity.
data.reasoning: Original description is identical to summary and lacks detail about inputs, outputs, and how results are ordered. Added clarity about what the search query parameter does, what is returned (tag objects with metadata), and how results are ranked to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'get_/tags/{tag-name}' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description is too generic and doesn't specify what information is returned or what the tag-name parameter represents. Enhanced description clarifies the path parameter requirement and specifies the TagInfo response schema for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_summary: Get information about a tag object.
data.current_description: Get information about a tag object.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve detailed information about a specific tag including its name, ID, and media count. Requires the tag name as a path parameter. Returns a TagInfo object containing tag metadata and statistics.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description is too generic and doesn't specify what information is returned or what the tag-name parameter represents. Enhanced description clarifies the path parameter requirement and specifies the TagInfo response schema for better AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'get_/users/search' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original description is identical to summary and lacks specificity. Added details about what parameters are accepted (query and count), what is returned (UserShortInfo objects with specific fields), and how results are ordered. This enables AI agents to understand the operation's capabilities and expected outputs.

data.current_summary: Search for a user by name.
data.current_description: Search for a user by name.
data.description_suggestion: Search for Instagram users by name or username. Accepts a search query parameter and optional count parameter to limit results. Returns a list of UserShortInfo objects containing user IDs, usernames, full names, and profile pictures. Results are ordered by relevance.

data.current_summary: Get information about a media object.
data.current_description:
Get information about a media object. The returned type key will allow you to differentiate between image and video media.

**Note:** if you authenticate with an OAuth Token, you will receive the user_has_liked key which quickly tells you whether the current user has liked this media item.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve media object details and metadata
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a specific media object identified by media-id. Returns a MediaEntry object containing media metadata including type (image or video), creation date, caption, and engagement metrics. When authenticated with OAuth token, includes user_has_liked flag indicating whether the current user has liked this media. Useful for displaying media details or checking user interaction status.

data.current_summary: Create a comment on a media object.
data.current_description:
Create a comment on a media object with the following rules:

  * The total length of the comment cannot exceed 300 characters.
  * The comment cannot contain more than 4 hashtags.
  * The comment cannot contain more than 1 URL.
  * The comment cannot consist of all capital letters.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new comment on a media object. Requires authentication and the comment text as input. Enforces validation rules: maximum 300 characters, maximum 4 hashtags, maximum 1 URL, and cannot be all capital letters. Returns a CommentEntry object with the created comment details including comment ID, text, author, and timestamp. Fails with validation error if constraints are violated.
data.reasoning: Description lists validation rules clearly but lacks information about authentication requirements, input parameters, return value, and error handling. Added these details to help AI agents understand what inputs are needed, what will be returned, and what errors might occur.

Improved summary to be more action-oriented and specific about the geography subscription context.

data.current_summary: Get recent media from a custom geo-id.
data.current_description:
Get recent media from a geography subscription that you created.

**Note:** You can only access Geographies that were explicitly created by your OAuth client. Check the
Geography Subscriptions section of the [real-time updates page](https://instagram.com/developer/realtime/).
When you create a subscription to some geography that you define, you will be returned a unique `geo-id` that
can be used in this query. To backfill photos from the location covered by this geography, use the
[media search endpoint](https://instagram.com/developer/endpoints/media/).

**Warning:** [Deprecated](http://instagram.com/developer/changelog/) for Apps created **on or after** Nov 17, 2015
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve recent media from geography subscription
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves recent media objects from a geography subscription that you created. You can only access geographies explicitly created by your OAuth client application. The geo-id is returned when you create a geography subscription. Returns a list of media objects (images and videos) from the specified geography. Note: This endpoint is deprecated for apps created on or after November 17, 2015. For backfilling historical photos, use the media search endpoint instead.
data.reasoning: Original description is verbose and unclear about what is returned. Added clarity on: (1) what the operation retrieves (recent media from subscribed geography), (2) access restrictions and authentication context, (3) what the geo-id represents, (4) expected output format, and (5) deprecation status. Improved summary to be more action-oriented and specific about the geography subscription context.

data.current_summary: Search for media in a given area.
data.current_description:
Search for media in a given area. The default time span is set to 5 days. The time span must not exceed 7 days.
Defaults time stamps cover the last 5 days. Can return mix of `image` and `video` types.
data.description_suggestion: Searches for media objects within a specified geographic area using latitude, longitude, and optional radius parameters. Returns a mix of image and video media types matching the search criteria. Time range filtering is supported with a default span of 5 days and maximum span of 7 days. Useful for discovering media from specific locations or backfilling historical content from defined geographies.
data.reasoning: Description mentions time constraints but lacks clarity on required geographic parameters and return format. data.current_summary: Get information about a media object.
data.current_description:
This endpoint returns the same response as `GET /media/{media-id}`.

A media object's shortcode can be found in its shortlink URL. An example shortlink is
`http://instagram.com/p/D/`, its corresponding shortcode is `D`.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve media information using shortcode identifier
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a media object using its shortcode instead of media ID. The shortcode is the unique identifier found in Instagram shortlink URLs (e.g., the shortcode 'D' from 'http://instagram.com/p/D/'). Returns the same media object response as the standard media endpoint, including metadata, engagement metrics, and associated comments/likes. Useful when you have a shortlink URL but need programmatic access to media details.
data.reasoning: Original description is unclear about the operation's purpose and doesn't explain what information is returned. Added: (1) clarification that this is an alternative to media ID lookup, (2) how to extract shortcode from URLs, (3) what is returned (media object with full details), (4) use case context. Improved summary to be more specific about the shortcode-based lookup approach.
